series.title: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
series.author: Inspiration and hunger are the fuel for all you desire. Zig Ziglar is the father of inspiration, inspiring the likes of Dave Ramsey, Seth Godin, John Lee Dumas, Dan Miller and the best of today's world changers.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 455: Q&A with Tom & Kevin
episodes.summary: This is the ever popular Q&A show with Tom Ziglar and Kevin Miller. You’ll hear questions such as “how do you know when it's time for you to start your own business”, “What did Zig Ziglar do between his humble beginnings as a door to door salesman and his stage in front of millions? What’s the in-between story?” and “I’m graduating college, how do I figure out exactly what to pursue”. The Q&A shows with myself and Tom Ziglar continue to grow in popularity with our audience, so I grabbed Tom out of a weeklong Ziglar Legacy Certification event at Ziglar headquarters, to get on the mic with me for 40 minutes. We had some great questions, and though I feel I rushed to answer them…we only got through 3. But that’s OK, as chances are, you will resonate with them. We were answering individuals, but on questions that pertain to most everyone listening to the show. Join as and hear real stories and feedback from others like you who are striving to inspire their…true performance!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 454: Threats to your self-image
episodes.summary: Zig Ziglar. On stage, and in a more intense mood than his somewhat jovial presentations. Why? He’s talking about self-image, a topic he was most passionate about it. In this message Zig’s focus is on some of the key things that cause a bad self-image. Thing is, we need to take audit of within ourselves, so we can correct them and succeed. This is a meaty show folks! Thanks to Constant Contact, Blue Apron and Princess Cruise Lines for their support of this episode!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 453: Ray Edwards – The copywriting formula you must follow to make sales
episodes.summary: Ray Edwards joins us today. He’s a renowned Communications Strategist, Copywriter, Author and Speaker. If you have any involvement in selling a product, service or message…or yourself, you really need to listen in. Most people commence to marketing, and skip over…the very thing that makes marketing efforts successful. All that effort to drive people to your offer, only to fail because the offer…does not connect.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 452: The power of relationships at work
episodes.summary: Today we hear a message from the legend of motivation and inspiration, the champion of personal development, Zig Ziglar. Today he walks us through some stats and reality of success in the workplace being highly dependent on the value of our relationships… even eclipsing our mastery of the job. The great news is it’s something we can change, immediately! He hits on 4 topics: 1) the value of appreciating others, 2) treating everyone like a VIP, 3) expecting the best from others so you can get the best from them and 4) treating everyone with care and respect. But let me caution you here, this is not about being humanitarian of the year Mr. or Mrs. Nice Guy. The point is teaching you how you can have far greater success in your life and work. And quite honestly, if you really pay attention to the message and then think about your own behavior, chances are you’ll recognize and have to admit that the qualities Zig is espousing here are not up to par in your life. But again, the great news is… you can address it now! You can take action today, and tomorrow and immediately begin increasing and securing your success. Thanks to Constant Contact, Pro Flowers and ZipRecruiter for their support of this episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 451: Q&A with Tom and Kevin
episodes.summary: We opened the door for questions and the Ziglar audience poured them in. In this show, we cover questions on establishing new habits, how to take personal retreats, dealing with unmotivated spouses and if it’s possible to pursue one’s dreams while having young kids! Thanks to Constant Contact and Pro Flowers for supporting this episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 450: Master productivity, discipline and focus – John Lee Dumas
episodes.summary: John Lee Dumas set the podcast world on fire with his show, Entrepreneur on Fire, and his business success. Last year we discussed his “Freedom Journal” on goal setting and achieving. Now he has come out with a product, really as a result of requests from his audience. The question of, “Hey, to achieve my goals, I need to be more productive, more disciplined and have more focus.” These are strengths of Johns, so he didn’t just write a book, he crafted a journal to help you work through achieving success in these three areas; Productivity, Discipline, Focus. This was an intriguing, valuable and truly fun show. Thanks so Constant Contact, Blue Apron and Princess Cruise Lines for supporting this episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 449: Inspired but alone
episodes.summary: Tom Ziglar & Kevin Miller answer real questions from podcast listeners. We have some tactical questions, and some deep, personal development questions today. Chances are 100% you’ll hear something that resonates, inspires, and equips you! Thanks to ZipRecruiter and Princess Cruise Lines for their support of this episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 448: A prospect for what you sell
episodes.summary: Your product, service, message and mission need a constant flow of the right people, “viable prospects”, getting exposure. Zig gives us a professional class on the topic, then we break down the high points. If you think you aren’t in sales…you’re listening to the wrong podcast. We all need this message, and will benefit from Zig’s counsel! Thanks to ZipRecruiter and Princess Cruise Lines for their support of this episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 447: Revisited, Zig on increasing your hope!
episodes.summary: If hope, is not the most important factor of success, it is at least the first step and foundation. Without hope, we either don’t ever take action, or we take weak action that does not produce success. With hope, we achieve astounding things. So here you go, start your New Year off with the first step in your quest for success, however you define it. Thanks to Blue Apron and ZipRecruiter for supporting this episode!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 446:  Rewrite your story with Owen Fitzpatrick
episodes.summary: Owen Fitzpatrick walks us through the tangible realities of changing our perspective and story from victim to overcomer. He shares as a psychologist, therapist and coach, but also from his own, hard story. His recent TEDx talk, “Mind Control: How to win the war in your head”, has had over 50,000 views in the first month, as he delivers and entertaining, yet poignant, 10-minute talk. This is foundational personal development for inspiring true performance.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 445: When should we accept “No”
episodes.summary: Zig tells his personal story of being rejected for his first sales position. When he finally got hired, he spent two and a half years…failing. Why did he keep pursuing this sales job when he was told he wasn’t qualified, he didn’t have any affinity for the product, and ultimately he proved them right by doing a poor job. Why did he continue? At face value, it’s hard to see that it was wise. We listen in, and then unpack it a bit. Thanks to Braintree for their support of this episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 444: Q&A with Tom Ziglar & Kevin Miller
episodes.summary: You sent in questions on specific issues addressed in recent shows…and today we answer. Tom Ziglar and Show host Kevin Miller candidly respond to real questions from real people striving to inspire their true performance!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 443: The beautiful challenge of personal responsibility – with Dan Miller
episodes.summary: Zig gives his story and Dan Miller helps us unpack the essence of overcoming vs being overcome. By life. By challenges. We dig into a drive, aspiration and the “DNA of desire”. This conversation really gets into the roots of why we do and don’t actually take action and make progress.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 442: Determine your habits and why and succeed – with Tom Ziglar
episodes.summary: In this show, we interview…Tom Ziglar. CEO of Ziglar and leader of the legacy! We recently got an iTunes 5-star review that simply said…”More Tom”. So…we aim to deliver, and today, we are! Tom Ziglar has been CEO of Ziglar for a long time, but since Zig passed away 3 years ago, Tom’s impact has ramped up dramatically. Today we make him the focus. Who is Tom? How did he come to run the Ziglar empire, and why? And what does he see for all of us in the future? What is our hope, our opportunity? Our possibility? Then we dig into one of his favorite topics…habit. This show went deep and is a profound commentary on the status of hope, encouragement, and inspiration in today’s world. This show may be the primer you need to hear, before any other show. Thanks to Harry’s Razors and Lenovo for their support of this show.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: Success, Goals, Attitude & Christmas!
episodes.summary: Tom Ziglar inspires our true performance by delivering some short, stout perspectives on Success, Goals and Attitude. Stand-alone value. For those who desire, he wraps up by sharing some amazing Ziglar Christmas gift packages!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 441: Telling the truth in advance
episodes.summary: Ziglar does not believe in “fake it until you make it”. But we do believe in “telling the truth in advance”. One of Ziglar’s most popular messages and offerings is his Self-Talk cards. In this show, host Kevin Miller digs in with Tom Ziglar to question and encourage the use of this most powerful tool for reprogramming your brain for success. Get yours free at Ziglar.com/selftalk. Thanks to Audible.com/ziglar and Lenovo for their support of this episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 440: Love your life, not theirs – with Rachel Cruze
episodes.summary: Rachel Cruze inspires our true performance by pointing out a primary reason we spend money we shouldn’t, and become controlled by it. What is it? Social status. In today’s culture there is something causing us to do this more than ever, and I would not have guessed what it was before reading her book. The culprit? Social Media. It’s not the bad buy, but the “highlight reel” is causing us to spend. So, what do we do about it? Listen to the show! Thanks so new sponsor Hello Fresh, and Braintree for their support of this episode of The Ziglar Show.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 439: Stop the anger
episodes.summary: In this message Zig expounds on the trajectory of anger and the necessity for us to understand it in others for what it so often is. It’s about them, not us. To rise above  it however, we must have a level of self-confidence and a self-protecting willingness to extend grace. Thank you so Salesforce and Lenovo for their support of this episode!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 438: Being Zig’s kid, the weird and good with Julie Ziglar Norman
episodes.summary: What can Zig teach you without speaking from a stage or a book? Let his youngest daughter tell you. He really was mortal, he wasn’t perfect, but the story is compelling. Plus get inspired by Julie’s message on “being the right person” as the key to your success. Thanks to Julie’s company, Prime Property Realty, for supporting this show. See what they have to offer you in investment values!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 437: Do people like you? Really?
episodes.summary: Your capability on the job is maybe half your opportunity. Being liked is the other half. And if you are not well liked, you’ll lose an opportunity to those who technically, are inferior to you. Don’t let this happens. Zig talks to us today about the value of being liked, and literally gives us “10 Commandments of Human Relations!” Thanks to Salesforce for supporting this episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 436: Sell with a Story – Paul Smith
episodes.summary: Remember. You ARE in sales. If you want people to hear you, frame your message in a story. You don’t have to be or become a “storyteller”, you just simply utilize short (1-2 minute) stories to dramatically increase your success in communicating a message. This is an intriguing and highly actionable show with author and speaker and authority on story, Paul Smith. Thanks so Harry’s Razors and Salesforce for their support of this episode!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 435: What you speak defines you
episodes.summary: None of us realize the gravity of this reality. What we speak…our statements, our responses, our conversations, define us to others. And thus, garner us respect and attraction, or disdain and distance. To varying degrees. This is BIG medicine folks. Listen to 8 minutes of Zig on stage, then we’ll hold some of his statements captive and as usual, break them down for better absorption! Thanks to Salesforce.com for their support of this episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 434: Provide value, get paid – with Jeff Goins
episodes.summary: Jeff Goins “stumbled” upon success. Meaning, he had an education, a good job, a family…and a joy in writing. So he wrote. For his work, in blogs and more, till something happened. His wife got pregnant and would lose their second income. Then he got serious. He turned his joy of writing and the value he was providing people through it, to not only a second income but a dramatic income. How? Providing value. But not to everyone. Just those who he personally related to. Sounds good, doesn’t it? It is. This is a must listen to show. Thanks to Salesforce for supporting this episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 433: Who taught you how to communicate?
episodes.summary: Chances are 99%...nobody. You are a novice. At best. Even if you’re better than anyone you know. Zig gives us the keys to what effective communication is, and how to do it well. Thanks so Salesforce for their support of this episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 432: Fire your boss! But keep your job - with Aaron McHugh
episodes.summary: Aaron McHugh takes us on a journey from cultural self-preservation and conforming, to true, epic self-preservation. But it doesn’t mean quitting your job. His message frees you to have the control and joy in your work that you’ve always dreamed of. Or possibly, never dreamed was possible! Thanks to Harry’s Razors, Salesforce and Kabbage for their support of this episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 431: Pay the price now to avoid the cost later
episodes.summary: Classic Zig gives us a 180 in this compelling message about the prices we pay today to avoid the far greater costs tomorrow. He frames it in a sales training message, but as you’ll hear in the show, we bring this incredibly valuable message directly home to your life. Mine too. Thanks to Performa Sleep and Kabbage for supporting this episode!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 430: Revisited: Zig’s 15 qualities of a successful person!
episodes.summary: Forget “Keys To Success” and what you should DO. Zig gives us qualities for success and how you should BE, in order to have more success. This is the foundation and possibly what you’ve been missing in your quest!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 429: Young, inspired and on fire
episodes.summary: Tom Ziglar brings us a new focus for Ziglar…inspiring today’s youth. He’s empowered two Ziglar leaders to lead an initiative to bring the Ziglar message of inspiration, motivation and massive personal transformation to today’s youth. If you ARE today’s youth, or you are parents or friends to today’s youth, you need to hear this…and pass it along! ZiglarYouth.com. Thank you to Performa Sleep and Kabbage for supporting this episode of The Ziglar Show!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 428: Never start over and dance with fear
episodes.summary: In show 424 we heard from Zig Ziglar and discussed the health of responding vs reacting. I invited questions. We got some on that topic, but it also just generated a bunch of great questions on the real life issues we cover here on The Ziglar Show regarding, “How do I really…inspire my true performance? Me, in my life?” So from personal development to some business development, we cover some big issues. One I want to pull out really questioned the issue of “positive thinking” and always being optimistic. Is it just being stoic and unemotional and…an unrealistic robot or Pollyanna persona? Then folks, near the end of the show we get into the issue of work you love, working at your passions. That’s where the excerpt from the top of the show came from and I think it will shed light on the topic that will be very reassuring and freeing for most of you. Thanks to ZipRecruiter and Braintree for sponsoring this episode of The Ziglar Show

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 427: How does your image affect your performance?
episodes.summary: And what should we do about it? Zig gives us a 10-minute message on the power of what others negatively say about us…that we agree with. Then what WE say to ourselves, that we agree with. Nobody has permission to minimize who we are, and we don’t have the right to agree with minimizing statements, as children of God. To walk this out however, we must be very countercultural. The human norm veers toward negative statements. We must combat and reverse this. Listen in as Zig inspires us toward…our True Performance!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 426: The Talented-Person Blind Spot – with Roy H Williams
episodes.summary: You have talent, and you’re probably somewhat blind to it. You minimize your talent and yourself. Which makes you…normal, according to Roy H Williams. On September 18, 2016 Roy sent out his weekly “Monday Morning Memo” and within moments of reading it, Ziglar Show host Kevin Miller contacted Roy’s camp and requested an interview as soon as possible. Days later it happened. Along with the topic at hand, they also took some majestic detours into personal and business branding, what humility actually is, and Roy’s take on following your passions. Thank you to ZipRecruiter for supporting this episode!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 425: Blame! Who or what?
episodes.summary: Who or what is to blame? People and things DO happen to us. We are victims. As Tom Ziglar states in this show, feeling blame us often justified and makes all the sense in the world. We’ve often got every right to feel that way! But do we use the blame as an excuse to confine us? Or do we do the illogical thing and…let it go. And succeed…anyway?! Thanks to NerdWallet and ZipRecruiter for supporting this episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 424: Do you respond or react to life?
episodes.summary: Zig asks us if we respond to life, or if we react to life? He explains the difference. Then he asks who or what do we allow to control our attitude, and therefore our actions? Who do we bequeath power to, or do we retain it for ourselves? Zig cites,  “You cannot tailor-make the situations in life, but you can tailor-make the attitudes in advance to fit that situation in life. But at the core of your ability is your own…self image.” We’re going to listen to about 11 minutes of Zig, then drill in on a few of those topics. Thank you to Wealthfront and Autodesk for their support of this episode!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 423: Why am I not changing?!
episodes.summary: We as humans often skip over the foundational step. The step of “being”. It comes before “doing” and from that, the end result…having. Zig makes two big points in this show, 1) We must first be (become) the right person, and 2) We must have vision. The clip from Zig is about 12 minutes, then we spend another 20 discussing the key points. Thanks to Autodesk for their support of this show!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 422: Zig’s primary lessons to his son
episodes.summary: Tom Ziglar answers a question in this Q&A with host Kevin Miller, about the most important lesson’s his Dad, Zig Ziglar, gave him as a child and adult. His answer uncovers possibly four of the most important lesson’s Zig has for us all. Thank you to Audible and new show sponsor, SmileDirectClub, for supporting this show!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 421: Friendship, partnership or romance? Which do you want?
episodes.summary: The 2nd installment of our recent focus on Zig’s favorite topic…marriage. Host Kevin Miller and his wife Teri tackle the 3rd question from Show #418, what percentage of a marriage should be friendship, partnership or romance? Then they cover a number of the over 600 questions and comments posted to their live, Facebook video. Thanks to Concordia University Wisconsin and Autodesk for supporting this episode!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 420: What agreements have you made with yourself?
episodes.summary: Zig asks, “What do you believe about yourself?!” This dictates everything you do in your life. Your decisions, your actions, your successes, and failures. For the most part, you get to choose what you will and won’t believe about yourself. That’s the good news. The current unfortunate news is…we all tend to believe what others say about us. Especially those closest to us. It shouldn’t be so. Listen in to hear Zig. Thanks to Braintree and Wealth Front for supporting this episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 419: How to love going home – Mark Timm
episodes.summary: Mark made millions in his business, but could hardly get himself to pull up the driveway to home. Why? He felt like a failure at home and would rather just stay at work where he experienced success and fulfillment. Until…he tried applying his successful work strategies with his family. Today Mark is the new CEO of Ziglar Family. Find them now and get your free “Raising Positive Kids” book at www.ZiglarFamily.com. Thanks to Concordia University of Wisconsin and Qualaroo for supporting this episode!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 418: Your marriage needs stress
episodes.summary: If it’s strong it will bolster your entire life. If it’s weak, it will cripple your world. Host Kevin Miller is joined by his wife Teri to discuss a message from Zig. They cover 1) What is the value of a good marriage and 2) What is the foundation of a good marriage? Thank you to Wealth Front and Earth Class Mail for supporting this show!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 417: Anything worth doing, is worth doing poorly…
episodes.summary: …until you can do it well. You need to hear the breakdown of that statement, as you can’t take it at face value. It is the launching point of this powerful message from Zig. We took it from “Strategies for Success – Blueprint of Achievement. Zig wraps up the entire series talking about goals and really achieving them. This is Zig at his inspirational summit.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 416: Get a Career Do Over with Jon Acuff
episodes.summary: You WILL hit a Career Ceiling. You WILL experience a Career Bump. You WILL make a Career Jump. You WILL get a surprise Career Opportunity. The question is, will you handle these invariable transitions victoriously? Of course, because you’re going to listen to this show and Jon’s counsel…

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 415: Quit praying and start listening – Bob Beaudine
episodes.summary: Bob Beaudine says this is THE secret that changes everything. We ask…how. Really. How? In real life, how do you tangibly ask God and hear anything specific? It sounds great, but in reality seems about as realistically tangible as levitating. I guarantee listening to this show will be a revelation to this concept.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 414: Withstanding the liquor of Success with Steve Smith
episodes.summary: We all want success in life, business, finances, relationships, health and more. But success can often have a high cost, namely in our peace, contentment, and happiness. Steve Smith has his own story as a rising megachurch pastor and the toll it took on his life. Today he’s now walked with thousands of C-level executives, business owners, megachurch pastors and high achievers, who have had aspects of crash-and-burn in their lives and businesses. What has he learned from this and how can we do pursue success…healthfully? Steve actually sat in the studio with Kevin and a candid, lively, in-depth and profound discussion took place. This is a must listen to from Ziglar’s True Performance Show.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 413: Hostile takeover of your mind
episodes.summary: This is the absolute crux of your entire life and existence regarding success and failure. You control it by what you speak and think. Practice the exercise in this show and declare war, rebellion and anarchy on yourself.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 412: Success programming for your brain
episodes.summary: Zig is helping us to actually achieve our goals, and it comes down to…us. What we do and don’t do. But don’t rely on sheer will. And definitely, don’t rely on happenstance. What are you doing, and not doing, every day…that is leading you? We listen to Zig then pull out three main points for better digestion. Thanks to Design Crowd, Braintree and Nerdwallet for supporting this show.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 411: Creating peace to withstand stress and chaos with Joanne Miller
episodes.summary: Life and the world is filled with stress and chaos. We can’t change that. But we can equip ourselves to deal with it, and a foundational necessity is having a place of peace and renewal. Our home. Our closest relationships. How do we go about creating this? In her book, “Creating a Haven of Peace”, Joanne F Miller guides us through the key ingredients needed to have a home of peace and relationships of love. At the end, is there anything we want more? And as Zig would say, this is the source of our power that will lead to our ultimate legacy. Thanks so Qualaroo and Blue Apron for their support of this show.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 410: Your next, radical, great decision
episodes.summary: Zig talks to us about the number one way to make your goals actually happen. It’s not an action, it’s a…being. Which is good and bad news, depending on…you. We like step-by-step things to do because doing seems easy. To “be” different feels harder, but then, it’s the thing we have the absolute most control over.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 409: Don Yaeger – Lessons from the greatest sports teams
episodes.summary: Don calls many of the greatest sport figures on the planet…friends. He’s privy to their personal lives and who they really are, and he’s studied them and the greatest sports teams on earth. From it…he found the primary ingredients that led to their success. He shares it in his book, and we dig in for this show.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 408: Your responsibility to be the hero
episodes.summary: Zig says to share your goals for accountability and encouragement, but be discerning who you share with. The root of goals…commitment. Why? It helps you overcome the obstacles that WILL come. You’ve got to be hard on yourself, and be the hero. These are just some of the topics we cover in this show. Thanks to HumanScale, Blue Apron and Earth Class Mail for their support of the show.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 407: Dan Harris – Train your brain and don’t be a jerk
episodes.summary: Meditation from a scientific perspective, stripping it of candles, incense, outfits and overall hoodoo spirituality. Dan Harris of ABC News’ Nightline says it’s simply about being mindful and taking captive what is going on in your head. Being unaware can lead to anxiety, panic attacks and…being a jerk. Dan had an on-air panic attack that brought his world to a halt and set him in search of a way to cope with the voice inside his head. The voice we all have

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 406: Get halfway to your goal in one hour
episodes.summary: Why is it that we put so much effort and time and use tools and resources to run our lives, but we ignore planning our lives? In this show we look at a one hour exercise to decide the destinations we are going to direct our efforts towards. We listen to Zig on stage for about 10 minutes, then break it down.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 405: John O’Leary says we all have trials. Now what?
episodes.summary: Nearly burned to death, John should have died, but decided not to. He thought he was a victim, then decided he was radically blessed. This is one of those stories you just can’t deny and it will further strip away the anchors we all have that keep us from progressing as we should. As we could. John’s book, “On Fire” is a current best seller and has made him a sought-after speaker where he calls people away from what he calls “accidental living”. Thanks to Design Crowd for supporting this episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 404: Want radical hope? Then you need faith.
episodes.summary: Your hope is built on…faith. No faith, no hope. But faith in what? We take a 14-minute commentary from Zig Ziglar on faith and break it down into bite size pieces. This truly is a root to our personal success or lack thereof. Thanks so Design Crowd and Earth Class Mail for their support of this episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 403: You need peer pressure
episodes.summary: We cover a lot of ground in this Q&A session. But the power of finding the right peer pressure trumps it all. You want to succeed? Find people and groups where succeeding in your area of desire, is the goal and the norm. It’s the primary ingredient for the best in every aspect of success…around the world. We also have a lively and controversial discussion on sales.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 402: Dina Dwyer Owens proves values make more money. 2 billion.
episodes.summary: Leading your life and business with high values is a great ideal, right? Dina Dwyer Owens has 2 billion to prove it also makes more cash. Which only begs the question of…why don’t we all lead our lives and businesses putting values first and foremost? This show was sponsored by Earth Class Mail and Blue Apron.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 401: Our future is as big as our hope
episodes.summary: “Men and women are only limited by the size of their hope,” Zig cites in this show. We also discuss what Jesus said in Matthew 18:1-4:  “I tell you the truth, unless you change and become like little children, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven. Therefore, whoever humbles himself like a child is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.”

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 400: Brian Buffini says we are drowning in information and starving for wisdom
episodes.summary: The Mindsets, Motivation and Methodologies of Success from a true, rags to riches story. Brian immigrated to the U.S. from Dublin, Ireland and moved to San Diego in 1986. He became a millionaire at age 26 and today has a worldwide coaching organization. His new podcast, “The Brian Buffini Show” has jumped to the top of the business rankings in iTunes. After hearing this interview, you’ll want to go subscribe. Thanks to Earth Class Mail for their support of this episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 399: Believe in a hope, trust in an action
episodes.summary: It’s Zig on stage talking about hope and making change. There is an epic analogy of when we are in a valley – when, not if – it’s what we plant there that we then eat in our bid to climb out and reach the peak. We also dig into the pithy statements and bible verses that leave out the crux. The “If” statement. This message comes from a paramount Ziglar product, Strategies for Success: Blueprint for Achievement which you can find at Ziglar.com, in the store, under MP3s. Thanks to Earth Class Mail and Backblaze for sponsoring this show.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 398: Q&A: Best product, balance and mental programming
episodes.summary: Three questions from listeners that Tom Ziglar, Kevin Miller and special guest Carrie Wilkerson cover – 1) If you were to invest in a product and you only had one choice, what product would that be today? 2) Can you focus on working mothers and how they balance family life and entrepreneurial or sales success? 3) Zig said to yell at the top of your lungs, "I feel happy, I feel healthy, I feel terrific!" It works today when I need to get past the self-doubt I experience occasionally. The show is brought to you in part by Backblaze.com/ziglar, which gives you unlimited, cloud backup.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 397: Simon Sinek on how to actually, authentically lead.
episodes.summary: The power of why and the reality of leadership are just two of numerous revelations you will receive from this show with Simon. There is little mystery in this interview, as Simon is astoundingly simple, direct and nearly irrefutable as he leads us in some primary tenants of personal success. This one will be hard to listen to only once.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 396: Do this, and you are done
episodes.summary: Is overcoming our lack and our excuses easy? Nope. Is it Simple. Well…yes. It is. But truth - black and white - is often simple. But not remotely easy. It’s dramatically hard! Get some classic Zig, then some real life breaking down with Kevin.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 395: Q&A Show: Deciding which idea to pursue and hard work is…hard
episodes.summary: Dan Miller joins Kevin to cover two big issues. Beverly asks, “I love to do so many different things. How do I decide which one to take the BIG step into?” Then Robin in Mississippi says, “Thank you from the bottom of my heart for saying how STUPID the cliché is, “If you do what you love you'll never work another day in your life". I love my work, but I work my backside off. I'm a nurse. I work at hospice. Everyone dies.” Tune in as we deeply unpack these two topics.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 394: Carrie Wilkerson reveals the labels that bind, and free us
episodes.summary: We all live under labels that were given to us, and many we gave to ourselves. Some gives us wings and roots! But more often than not, they limit us and hold us tight to far less than the possibility we have within us. It’s not as easy as simply saying, “Hey, I don’t think I’ll accept that label anymore!” When we live in a label for so long, getting rid of it is like learning a foreign language. In this show we get to the push and shove and challenge of really relabeling ourselves, and the massive power it can unleash.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 393: You have more power than you may want
episodes.summary: When you understand the dramatic power you really have, it can be daunting and cause you to shy away from taking action. When you DON’T understand the dramatic power you really have, you become a victim. We break down this concept in the show and flesh it out so we can all take more appropriate action and responsibility in our lives.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 392: Battling comfort, rocking sales and more – The new Q&A show
episodes.summary: Your live questions! Tom Ziglar and I fielded questions from show listeners, submitted at Ask.ZigShow.com. But Tom aired the show live on Facebook and we took questions straight from the Ziglar fan page! Listen in and relate to others like you seeking to inspire their true performance! And send in your questions to Ask.ZigShow.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 391: The story that matters most – from John Eldredge
episodes.summary: What story matters most? What story is most relevant for you? For your family? For humanity. Could it be your own? Wait, did you know your life was a story? Do you realize the only way to make sense of and succeed in life is to understand, embrace and fully live out your story? And last, if this is new to you, what do you do today, to tangibly step into this story? Listen in as legendary author, counsel and teacher, John Eldredge, gives us a story, on story.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 390: Procrastinate on purpose with Rory Vaden
episodes.summary: Multiply your time and procrastinate on purpose. And as you’ll hear in a 20 second clip right after you hit play for the show, Rory says time management isn’t logical, it’s emotional. And there is the crux for why we seldom do it well! He lays out some heavy paradigm shifters that I vow, will help you finally…not manage your time (Rory stats that you can’t!), but multiply it, once and for all.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 389: The necessity of having rewarding work
episodes.summary: Name the definition of success for you? The specific realities, circumstances, ingredients and outcomes. It can’t be 100% altruistic, it must contain some personal desires. Zig gives us 15-minutes on stage discussing what we all want, how much our work life impacts everything, and the power of…love. Then I, Kevin, dig into the two primary topics. NEW SHOW! > Remember as you listen…when a question, idea, or frustration comes up, let us know! Go to ask.ZigShow.com. You’ll hear an excerpt from a submitted question in this show. Much thanks to Amazon Kindle and Concur for sponsoring the show.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 388: John Hayes and the power of proven systems
episodes.summary:
Systems. Routines. Habits. Proven
steps. These are what franchises are made of, and they are
foundational to our personal and business success. We discuss this
with longtime Ziglar personality, and one of
today's foremost experts
on franchises, John Hayes.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 387: What are your personal standards?
episodes.summary: Doing a “good enough”job, just enough to get by, leads nowhere. While excellence andhigh standards pay off in massive ways. Zig takes us through somepersonal stories of how he was taught. We all need to tangiblywrite down our own…personal standards.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 386: Chris Guillebeau - How to dominate by opting out
episodes.summary: Some people swim upstream. Somefight against the flow. Some rebel. And some simply opt out andrather peacefully chart a different course. It may even lead toworld domination. Got your interest? Meet ChrisGuillebeau.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 385: Winning relationships start here
episodes.summary:
Healthy relationships come hand in
hand with true success. Show me a successful person, and you’ll
find someone with a bevy of deep, true, meaningful relationships.
What is the common thread that is the binding clasp for all winning
relationships? This is the topic of today’s show.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 384: Kyle Wilson and the power of full immersion
episodes.summary: What you immerse yourself in, will change your life. Kyle immersed himself in the lives and businesses of great leaders and influencers and captains of positive, personal development. It took its toll. Kyle has had massive success. He is the go-to guy for big name authors and speakers and helps others get immersed in those works, much to the detriment of their average lives. Get immersed in greatness and you can’t help but do great things!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 383: Raising fully functional kids
episodes.summary: Teri, my bride, is back to give commentary with me on a clip from Zig where he’s asking if it’s tougher today, to raise positive kids in a negative world. If you have kids…if you want them to succeed, I implore you to listen in. This is about the roots of their lives.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 382: Brian Tracy’s hack to personal development success
episodes.summary: This is a “root issue” hack, not a shortcut. Brian Tracy is a legend in personal development. An icon. And he’s still at it hard. No sugar coating, no fluff. He dives right to the heart of personal success. Do yourself a favor and join him…

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 381: The fastest way to success. Seriously.
episodes.summary: I don’t like that title, because it’s hard to believe. But when you hear the answer and hear Tom Ziglar and I, Kevin, break it down, I honestly think you’ll agree. I actually don’t know how you CAN’T agree. So…it’s a big deal. Try it on for size.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 380: Striving and struggling for your calling
episodes.summary: Dr. Ramesh Richard walks us through, “We each have an individual calling. It is our responsibility to pursue it. The pursuit will be a hard life, full of striving and some struggle. It will also be the most joyful, glorious and fulfilling life we can imagine.”​

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 379: The unavoidable root of your health and happiness
episodes.summary: Zig expounds on one of his primary pillars of success…relationships. He shares studies showcasing the number one cause of physical and emotional unhealth, is relational unhealth. We have to audit our relationships, or they’ll undermine all our other efforts. Listen in as we unearth this vital issue.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 378: Kevin Kruse, time travel and extreme productivity
episodes.summary: He interviewed 7 Billionaires, 13 Olympic Athletes, 29 Straight-A Students, and 239 Entrepreneurs and wrote a book that is the culmination of what he found. It’s called “15 Secrets Successful People Know About Time Management.” We walked through all 15 points. “Time travel” is #4. Follow just a couple and you’ll change your life.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 377: Fear not. But how?
episodes.summary: The phrase “Fear not” occurs in the Bible 365 times. If you think you don’t fear, do you worry? Do you ever have anxiety? Those are forms of fear. Zig takes us through a very scriptural talk about faith. The power of it, and the necessity of faith for your overall success.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 376: You are either doing it. Or choosing to wait
episodes.summary:
You are not in need of more knowledge in order to go after your goal, destiny, calling, conviction or dream. You have enough and know enough to start. Times today are the same as they were eons ago in relation to progressing forward. Or not. So listen…maybe for the last time.
This show is brought to you in part by PIPEDRIVE, the CRM for small teams with big ambitions. Ziglar uses Pipedrive to help coordinate our sales pipeline. Head over to Pipedrive.com/ziglar to start your exclusive 60-day free trial only available to listeners of this show.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 375: Being you is your only shot
episodes.summary: Dan Miller joins host Kevin Miller in a father-son discussion, using a 5-minute talk from Gary Vaynerchuk as a launching point. The topic…are you to be exactly you? Or become something else in order to achieve success. Is it a balance? Is it adding, subtracting, refining? How is all the pursuit of personal development working for you? Listen in.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 374: It’s all about respect
episodes.summary:
Mutual respect is the core of relational health and wealth. Kevin & Teri Miller break down Zig’s clip where he hits on true success. You can win all the trappings of life and not be happy. But build a successful marriage, and you have it all. 
This show is brought to you in part by PIPEDRIVE, the CRM for small teams with big ambitions. Ziglar uses Pipedrive to help coordinate our sales pipeline. Head over to Pipedrive.com/ziglar to start your exclusive 60-day free trial only available to listeners of this show.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 373: Have an affair in your marriage
episodes.summary:
If that title intrigues you…good. It should. It hits to the heart of one of Zig’s foundational messages and foundations of true success. We listen to a seven minute clip from Zig, than my wife Teri joins me in the studio to dig in. If you are married, or ever plan to, please…listen in.
 
This show is brought to you in part by PIPEDRIVE, the CRM for small teams with big ambitions. Ziglar uses Pipedrive to help coordinate our sales pipeline. Head over to Pipedrive.com/ziglar to start your exclusive 60-day free trial only available to listeners of this show.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 372: Roy H. Williams and the blessing of pain
episodes.summary:
One of the worlds greatest wells of business wisdom, Roy H Williams, shares a theme I (Kevin) have been hearing a lot about lately. How those who come from hardship, generally outshine those we would normally deem “more fortunate”. But after hearing his testimony, I think you’ll begin to question what truly is a better fortune; trial or ease. But what if you have had it relatively easy? What do you do? Listen in…
This show is brought to you in part by PIPEDRIVE, the CRM for small teams with big ambitions. Ziglar uses Pipedrive to help coordinate our sales pipeline. Head over to Pipedrive.com/ziglar to start your exclusive 60-day free trial only available to listeners of this show.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 371: How to speak truth into YOUR life
episodes.summary: “As a man thinketh, so is he.” “Whether you think you can, or you think you can't…you're right.” Pithy quotes that speak absolute truth. We live and die by what we tell ourselves. We literally write our story every day. Come along with us and write the story you are responsible to write.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 370: Jason Frenn finds your authentic voice
episodes.summary: We are all speakers, whether the stage is in front of thousands, in front of 10, or in front of one. The best strategies for success? Know your material, stop your negative internal voices, and most of all…tell the truth. If you want to truly help anyone, in any way, you need to hear this message. The world truly is a stage. You must master it if you care to influence it.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 369: Create your world and know your reason
episodes.summary: Every day the world you live in is created by your attitude. Either you dictate it, someone else does, or your attitude does. This is the first focus of the show. Next we hit on motivation. Which is motive. Which is…your reason. If you aren’t clear on this, you are a race car with an empty fuel tank. But as you’ll hear in the show, we look at what you think you actually want, and find what to cut loose and free you from, in order to hone in what you really, truly want.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 368: Seth Godin wants you to be his legacy
episodes.summary:
Seth gives immense honor to Zig’s dramatic impact in his life, and ends the interview with what he hopes his legacy to be…and how it can be YOU. He also shares how Zig’s message kept him from quitting and why Zig’s message stood out from the rest. Seth cites that the root of sales is removing fear, social network grooming is hiding, and everybody should blog daily. And more. Listen and learn.
 
This show is brought to you in part by PIPEDRIVE, the CRM for small teams with big ambitions. Ziglar uses Pipedrive to help coordinate our sales pipeline. Head over to Pipedrive.com/ziglar to start your exclusive 60-day free trial only available to listeners of this show.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 367: Immediate consequences change everything
episodes.summary: What would we do if your daily habits and decisions had immediate consequences instead of slow, long term fruition? It would be the most life changing reality we ever encountered. Period. Zig sets the stage and Kevin poses the perspective.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 366: Michael Hyatt’s GPS for your life
episodes.summary:
Possibly the most concise, tangible, and relevant concept for literally have an overall direction for your life…ever. Michael Hyatt and co-author Daniel Harkavay will help you understand in six minutes flat, what most people can’t grasp a concept of in a lifetime. Listen and be…changed.
 
This show is brought to you in part by PIPEDRIVE, the CRM for small teams with big ambitions. Ziglar uses Pipedrive to help coordinate our sales pipeline. Head over to Pipedrive.com/ziglar to start your exclusive 60-day free trial only available to listeners of this show.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 365: Being positive yet being real
episodes.summary: Zig is king of positive thinking. Few that listen to his message outwardly refute it. But in our personal lives, in our heads…we often do. We want to make a bad situation good, but it’s hard to deny the situation really IS bad. And it hurts. Flat out denying that is not healthy, and it is NOT what Zig is about. Feel it. But…we can’t let it overcome it. There are two types of people. Everyone is going to encounter negative, hurtful realities of life. Some feel it, let it shape, define and defeat them. Some feel it, acknowledge it, but then…decide to rise above it. Which are you?

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 364: The challenge of real change
episodes.summary:
Real people, real efforts, real stories, real trials and overcoming. We hear from 12 people who are working to “change their stars”. We get the good, the glorious…the bad and the ugly.
 
This show is brought to you in part by PIPEDRIVE, the CRM for small teams with big ambitions. Ziglar uses Pipedrive to help coordinate our sales pipeline. Head over to Pipedrive.com/ziglar to start your exclusive 60-day free trial only available to listeners of this show.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 363: Develop and maintain the right attitude
episodes.summary: Zig charges us with doing the hard work of drilling for our potential, discovering it, bringing it to the surface then presenting it for use. We have greatness in us, but it’s useless and moot unless we commit to it.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 362: Being resilient and taking big steps
episodes.summary:
Jahbari McLennan had a dream. He achieved it. Then realized he’d “lost his passion for the game”. So at the top of his game, he walked away. Today he just signed a deal for a new game that more aligns with his core calling. This is a real world story that will resonate with you!
This show is brought to you in part by PIPEDRIVE, the CRM for small teams with big ambitions. Ziglar uses Pipedrive to help coordinate our sales pipeline. Head over to Pipedrive.com/ziglar to start your exclusive 60-day free trial only available to listeners of this show.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 361: Your game plan for the week
episodes.summary: Zig brings his absolute best to the root of it all, your self-image. And while he wants you to aspire to some big goals and have a game plan for your life, he also shares that at the age of 45, he was broke and in debt. He started small. A game plan for…the day. The week. And on from there. This we can all do. So…let’s do it!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 360: Quit telling and start asking
episodes.summary:
Bob Tiede trains leaders and he's found the primary key to effective leadership, which turns conventional thinking, and habit, on it's head. If you've ever heard the wisdom to "shut up and listen",you'll get a similar paradigm shift with  "quit telling and start asking". This will literally change your future interactions with...everyone.
This show is brought to you in part by PIPEDRIVE, the CRM for small teams with big ambitions. Ziglar uses Pipedrive to help coordinate our sales pipeline. Head over to Pipedrive.com/ziglar to start your exclusive 60-day free trial only available to listeners of this show.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 359: The seeds of your greatness
episodes.summary: Zig gives us 22 minutes from his life changing Success Strategies series, this is the 2nd of 3 parts on Self-Image, the bedrock of all success. We agree with all you've ever thought, simply changing your paradigm will NOT make you a superhero the next day. Maybe the next year...if you grow the "seeds of greatness" Zig claims you are endowed with.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 358: Be CEO of your home!
episodes.summary: Mark Timm shares his journey and solutions for being ultra successful with his industry leading business, yet failing at home. He took the same principles that made him a rockstar CEO in business, and applied them at home. The results changed his home life, and the lives of his entire family. I, your host Kevin Miller, have been implementing them in my home with my large family. Folks, tune in to this show. It is truly significant.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 357: Your success-switch
episodes.summary:
21 minutes of Zig on his #1 success strategy. You can have everything; knowledge, skill, experience, ability, brilliance…everything. Without personal belief, it won’t benefit you or others. Change your perspective on yourself, change your life, other’s lives and this world. It’s not easy. It’s just…vital. Let’s do it.
 
This show is brought to you in part by PIPEDRIVE, the CRM for small teams with big ambitions. Ziglar uses Pipedrive to help coordinate our sales pipeline. Head over to Pipedrive.com/ziglar to start your exclusive 60-day free trial only available to listeners of this show.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 356: 10 habits of sales superstars
episodes.summary: Sales pro Butch Bellah walks us through the 10 Essential Habits of Sales Superstars, and gives Ziglar listeners a free download of his book that gives even more. Zig famously said, “Everyone is in sales”, because sales is influence. We all want to influence others, and we try to daily. We all need to become more effective, for our sake and those we care about!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 355: Where. Are. You. Going?!
episodes.summary:
John Lee Dumas gets real with us on what he learned from interviewing 1,200 entrepreneurs. What do they all have in common? What is the one common thread for their success? What led them out of the failures they all experienced? One thing. Listen in. Really. Listen in.
This show is brought to you in part by PIPEDRIVE, the CRM for small teams with big ambitions. Ziglar uses Pipedrive to help coordinate our sales pipeline. Head over to Pipedrive.com/ziglar to start your exclusive 60-day free trial only available to listeners of this show.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 354: Success & Failure stories
episodes.summary: We read through scores of emails sent in by The Ziglar Show audience on their successes, challenges and failures in taking action for their self-improvement. These are real world stories that will undoubtedly resonate with you as you journey on your own path of Inspiring YOUR True Performance.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 353: How to be Fully Charged
episodes.summary: Tom Rath’s new book and movie has us fired up, and in this show we get behind the scenes on the research that led to Tom’s “Three Keys to Energizing Your Work and Life”, and of course, dig in deep the the challenges and opportunities in aspiring to be…fully charged. This is not a mere interview. It’s a revelation.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 352: Everything affects everything else
episodes.summary: Zig delivers 10 minutes of power that we break down with some significant points regarding, Hope, Belief, Taking Action, Encouragement, doing the Right Thing and Reaping what you Sow. You’ll find tangible, actionable opportunity from this show!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 351: Andy Andrews asks what standards you live by?
episodes.summary: We all have standards by which we live. Some are very shallow and broad, some narrow and deep. Some intentional and clear, some just by happenstance. We also cover why Andy went from successful corporate speaking to include a big focus on parenting. And how in both, “standards” are a prominent root.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: Special: Zig & Tom on slowing down time for Christmas
episodes.summary: This is a special, one minute Christmas message from Zig. A blessing and a charge. Then Tom Ziglar shares what Christmas was like in the Ziglar home as a child. This is pure sweetness and…​​inspiration!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 350: Dave Ramsey cites fear as the #1 enemy of change
episodes.summary: We all have hope, belief and desire for progress. But why is it so hard to change? Dave Ramsey, in this intimate interview, says the chief enemy is…FEAR. This didn’t start out as the focus for the interview, but we landed on it hard. This is true…inspiration.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 349: Gratitude is the Holy Grail
episodes.summary: Is it? Seriously? Can being grateful really change things or is it a pithy, naive platitude? Let’s listen to Zig and then talk about it in real-world terms.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 348: How have you been programmed?
episodes.summary: Zig brings us a talk from the stage on The Power of Words. How we have been pre-programmed by words our entire life, and are therefore not living free and true. How to live free and true? Listen in.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 347: Is there Godly aspiration and ambition?
episodes.summary: Ken Coleman, host of Dave Ramsey’s Entreleadership podcast, delivers a profound message on humanity’s One Question: ”What should I do with my life? Why am I here?” Then we delve down deeper to the foundation of his message, the calling on your life. And Godly aspiration and ambition. Watch out. You may very well find the permission you’ve needed to break out of your normal.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 346: You must see more for yourself
episodes.summary: Nobody on the planet is immune to needing this message. It’s impossible. We all are victims of our own narrow views of ourselves and limitations. Some have drastic limitations, some have mild, albeit  subversive, erosions that handicap their efforts. This show will be an effort to recognize that you invariably need to expand your view of yourself. We have 13 minutes of Zig, then Tom Ziglar and Kevin Miller break it down.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 345: Are you a motivation junkie, or action taker?
episodes.summary: Positive content is vital for a successful life. But...it's a means to an end. If you intake and intake and never take any action, then it's merely positive entertainment. Listen in to Zig and get challenged, then we'll take it deeper and get convicted for change.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 344: Being trustworthy doesn’t mean people trust you
episodes.summary: And if they don’t trust you, you are handicapping your progress and success and potential. Listen in and find out how to turn your trustworthiness into actually being trusted. And see all the doors you wish were opened to you…bust open.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 343: Get Intentional With Your Attitude
episodes.summary: Just think positive? Really? Is that that easy? No. It’s not. Which is why we listen to a 22 minute clip of Zig, then spend about the same time digging into what being “Positive” is all about, and what’s really in it for us. It’s not just a perspective. It’s a tactic for getting more out of most anything and anytime.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 342: Righteous Cash & Your Performance
episodes.summary: Rabbi Daniel Lapin says making money is a certificate of your performance. How does that set with your faith and money views? That’s Rabbi’s skill set, to masterfully relate the physical and the spiritual in ways that will make you stop, take notice and maybe make a life altering (for the better) change!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 341:  15 qualities of a successful person
episodes.summary: Forget “Keys To Success” and what you should DO. Zig gives us qualities for success and how you should BE, in order to have more success. This is the foundation and possibly what you’ve been missing in your quest!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 340: Does how many you serve equal how much you make?
episodes.summary: Sounds like a headline that will get shot down. Does it? Guest Bob Burg, bestselling author of “The Go-Giver” talks us through this controversial statement and issue. And helps us understand the subtle difference between being a go-getter and a Go-Giver. It’s life altering for your success. Listen closely.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 339: You are what you’re told you are
episodes.summary: A story of someone with significant restrictions on their capabilities. Zig asked them, because he simply needed their help, for more. They tried…and it radically altered the trajectory and amazing success of their life. How can you receive and give this reality? Open up and listen in.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 338: Business IS Personal
episodes.summary: Howard Partridge is Ziglar Incs go to source for business counsel and training. That alone should say enough. In this show, we grill Howard on successful business principles, leadership and his own, personal journey.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 337: What do you want?
episodes.summary: Zig schools us in how to make a desire a reality, with the core being something you want bad enough to actually commit to. A 19-minute clip of classic Zig followed by an in depth commentary from Ziglar hosts Kevin Miller and Tom Ziglar.  Also includes a significant study cited by Zig on how the amount of TV one views being directly correlated to vocational success in income levels!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 336: The need for wisdom
episodes.summary: Fred Smith was one of Zig Ziglar’s primary mentors, and today his daughter Brenda is keeping her father’s legacy alive. She is gathering people who have had great success in their lives and are now in their 60s and 70s…onto college campuses to pass down wisdom to tomorrow’s world changes. Today’s youth need to be equipped to fail and overcome and go beyond mere knowledges to…wisdom. Don’t we all?!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 335: What are the real catalysts for life change?
episodes.summary: 238 Facebook comments to this question, “If you’ve ever made a significant change in your life, will you share what the main catalyst or cause was? Was it a message, a person, a life circumstance or something else? What caused the tipping point? Hosts Kevin Miller and Tom Ziglar read through many to share the real world success stories from people just like you!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 334: Success or Survival, which is your objective?
episodes.summary: Are you truly living for success, or just survival? The answer isn’t as easy as you think. Is it too late for you? Do you know how to connect with people emotionally? Why does God repeat Himself? Why do you get so much done the day before a vacation and how can you harness that EVERY day?! Tune it and Zig will lead you to…your true performance!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 333: How to require and expect more from yourself
episodes.summary: Zig gives us a paradigm shift for how we can view ourselves in a new light. A better light. With classic down to earth, practical application. This is a 16 minute clip from Zig followed by a discussion by hosts Kevin Miller and Tom Ziglar

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 332: Reprogramming Your Reality
episodes.summary: Self-talk card experiences and feedback, the long awaited show. Tom Ziglar and Kevin Miller talk through countless testimonials from listeners who committed to reading Zig’s renowned Self-Talk cards for 30-days. Hear the challenges and rewards. It’s nothing short of supernatural. The ultimate finding? There’s not a specific answer to WHY the self-talk generates such profound benefits. Trust. The. Process. Listen in to understand fully.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 331: The Foundations of Personal Success
episodes.summary: What is true success…personally? When you take all the stuff away and it’s just you? Without that, nothing else will add up to much. Zig takes a personal experience during his writing of “See You At The Top” to give us his heart on 16 attributes of what it really is to be…at the top.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 330: Money Goal - Survival, Enough or Abundance?
episodes.summary: 277 comments on Facebook to the question of, “What is your goal financially?” 1) Have just enough to get by, 2) Have more than needed, 3) Have a significant, substantial abundance. And WHY? Host Kevin Miller was joined by his Dad and “48 Days To The Work You Love” author Dan Miller. The show went long because there was so much ground to cover. The goal was…paradigm shift. You judge if it worked.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 329: Are you buying what you are selling?
episodes.summary: This is directly aimed at your work. What you spend Mon-Fri doing. There is a very high chance you are violating, or at the least not harnessing, a core principle for work and life success. Zig lays it out like he’s so masterful at doing, so it cuts you off at the knees…the builds you back stronger and taller than ever. Here’s to you.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 328: How much money are you working to accumulate?
episodes.summary: Dan Miller of 48 Days To The Work You Love fame leads us as we challenge the conscious and subconscious perspectives most of us have in regards to accumulating money, millionaires, self-employment, sales professionals, the value of formal education and “natural born brain surgeons”. This episode is cocked, loaded and will inspire and challenge you!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 327: Mumbo Jumbo Motivational Stuff
episodes.summary: Jordan Harbinger, host of the top ranked, “The Art of Charm” podcast, tell us his Zig story. He was critical of the concept, "You can have everything in life you want, if you will just help other people get what they want." But he tested it, and it changed his life. Today he devote himself to leading and inspiring others to…more. In business, relationships and life. If you value The Ziglar Show, check out www.TheArtOfCharmPodcast.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 326: Break down to build up
episodes.summary: A powerful 10-minute message from Zig, from which we get this statement, "When you don’t have focus, you put energy into not losing what you have, and you don’t gain much. When you have focus you put energy into gain, and you can’t lose!” Then we share an intimate confession from Tom Ziglar on what really made his Dad the icon he grew to be. It's not what you'll expect to hear, at all. Our show was brought to you by next week's special guest, Jordan Harbinger of the famed ArtOfCharmPodcast.com.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 325: What’s in the way of your hope?
episodes.summary: We posed this question to our 3.5 million Ziglar Facebook Fanpage audience, and got a wealth of responses. I (Kevin) picked groups of similar replies and posed them to Tom Ziglar and Dan Miller. What came out was one of the deeper shows to date. No doubt, you’ll find a response you can relate to. I also gave a charge to one unreasonable person…to mentor them through an upcoming Ziglar Legacy Certification course. Listen in…and change your life.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 324: Knowing when to stick it out  or move on elsewhere
episodes.summary: When you are in a negative environment, when do you know to stick it out, endure, tolerate and remain…and when should you get out of there?! There is no cookie cutter answer. But in this show we had Bob Beaudine in the office to get to the nitty gritty on this issue. Bob is a renowned Ziglar champion, and the man who Sports Illustrated called, “the top front-office matchmaker in sports”. We listen to a 3-minute clip from Bob, then break it down. He starts off saying, “Life isn’t often fair.” From that, we discussed 3 points, 1) When you get rejected and put down and minimized, you may be on the wrong team, in the wrong crowd, at the wrong company, 2) Rejection can be a reminder of who you are and who you are not, 3) Go where you’re celebrated, not where you’re tolerated. You’ll be inspired, and get a paradigm shift. This show was brought to you by Harry’s Razors - Harrys.com - get a $5 discount by entering ZIGLAR into the coupons code. And Igloo intranet software, get a free trial at igloosoftware.com/ziglar

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 323: Your future, your success - equals the size of your hope. You must have more.
episodes.summary: John Johnson said, “It’s the size of your hope that’s going to determine how far you’ll go in your life.” John Maxwell said, “If there’s hope in the future there’s power in the present.” The focus of this show is, You Need More Hope. You need to increase it and enhance it and establish it. I, your host Kevin Miller, took more notes on this 13-minute clip from Zig than any show so far. Thus the longer show where Tom Ziglar and I cover some significant ground.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 322: Stop selling and start helping
episodes.summary: If you think sales is not a topic that interests you or pertains to you…you haven’t listened to much of Zig. We all sell everyday, and true selling is serving. You’ve got to understand what people need and want, then give people areason and an excuse for buying.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 321: Realize your blindness and get some vision
episodes.summary: Zig gets serious on the need for vision and direction in your life, if you want to progress beyond...normal. We hit some hardcore points. Top Performance doesn't happen to you, you happen to it. What is getting in your way? We gave a gift...get a free Ziglar book, or other, now. Go to Audible.com/Ziglar

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 320: The most life changing thing you’ll ever encounter
episodes.summary: Zig cites this message as flat-out...paramount. We cover it, discuss it and give away a free resource to try it for yourself. It's a group effort together, along with host Kevin Miller, who admits he has never done this exercise himself. We'll all walk it out for 4-weeks and do a follow up show to share the results.You game? Get your free self-talk cards at Ziglar.com/selftalk

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 319: Marital devotion for overall success
episodes.summary: Is marital health and devotion directly tied to success at work and in business? Why did Zig make marriage a primary part of his platform? What does it mean to be devoted, truly? What makes a strong marriage? Listen in...

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 318: Trying, learning and failing
episodes.summary: This is part 2 from show #317, "Handling what happens to you" (make sure you've heard it and listened to Zig's clip we reference here). We discuss Zig's points on Trying and discuss the pursuit of Significance and "Understanding" what we hear and read.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 317: Handling what happens to you
episodes.summary: Possibly one of Zig’s most powerful messages. Hard things will happen to you. They happen to everyone. Why do some overcome and still succeed, and others succumb and never progress? Listen to this message from Zig, then a candid, raw discussion.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 316: Zig on Self-Employment
episodes.summary: In a rare interview, July 2010, Ziglar Show host Kevin Miller interviewed Zig on his advocacy for self-employment. This is a 7-minute clip from that interview that will inspire those desiring self-employment, and will be a comfort to those already self-employed.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 315: The 12 inches to success
episodes.summary: To help influence someone in a direction that will benefit them requires authentic communicating skills and caring, and comes from the heart. Today we get a message from Zig then hear again from Bryan Flanagan about his own path to career success by connecting his head to his heart.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 314: Positive thinking won’t let you do anything
episodes.summary: For those wary of the “positive thinking movement,” this will resonate. Life is real and it’s challenges aren’t simply abolished by how you think. For all who believe in being positive and optimistic, this clip from Zig and following commentary from hosts Tom Ziglar and Kevin Miller will help your application, expectations and outcomes.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 313: Sales and people’s perspectives with their priorities
episodes.summary: Everyone is in sales. You, your spouse, your kids, boss, coworkers, employees... Anyone who effectively helps others, does so through…selling. Which is influence. 30 year Ziglar veteran leader, trainer, speaker, presenter and masterful influencer Bryan Flanagan joins us today to discuss how to apply sales skills to our everyday and professional lives

episodes.seriesTitle: The Ziglar Show - Inspiring Your True Performance
episodes.title: 312: The First Date
episodes.summary: Biz success is hard when there isn't success at home. This is why Zig so often used his platform of motivation and inspiration to talk on marriage. The key relationship that can so often make or break our overall achievement. This is a great message on keeping perspective on marriage and retaining the flame of...the first date. Then hosts Kevin and Tom discuss how they have, and haven't, walked this out in their own marriages.

This podcast will be updated weekly with Zig Ziglar's Inspiring words of encouragement.  Did you know the original title for Biscuits, Fleas and Pump Handles? It has since been changed to See You At the Top and has been one of his most popular and life changing books.  Today I want Zig to share with you the story of the biscuits.
